intro: Hypericum salicaria, commonly known as yellow archangel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated edge. Hypericum salicaria is often found in moist meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks.
